title-group.article-title: Book Review of “Food for Tots: A Brief Guide to Feeding Your Child From Birth to Six Years Old”

article-meta.product: WoolleyJaniceMD, FAAP PugmireJennifer Mercer Island, WA: Food for Tots Publishing • 2012

body.p: The authors: Dr Janice Woolley is a seasoned pediatrician and her daughter, Jennifer Pugmire, is a mother of five children. Their original full-volume guide to the feeding of young children was written in 2001 and is now in its fourth revision.
The full text is a guide to feeding preschool children written for parents, caregivers, teachers, and others who care what children eat.
This condensed volume of 64 pages contains excerpts from this publication, including

list-item.p:
general feeding guidelines for ages
0 to 12 months
12 to 24 months
2 to 6 years

information on
food allergies
food safety: choking hazards, food preparation and handling
food intolerance in children
raising healthy eaters
what to feed sick kids
plus 20 pages of recipes, charts, and tips

body.p: The information is straightforward, simple, and written at a sixth- to eighth-grade reading level. The publisher also offers 2 pamphlets: one on “How to Raise a Healthy Eater,” which describes the

7 “R”s for healthy eating—responsibility, respect, resist, reinforce, replace, recognize, and relax and the second on “What to Feed Sick Kids” for coughs/colds/fever/vomiting and diarrhea and also a set of 12 kid-focused recipes cards. These materials are available in both English and Spanish.

The authors’ goals of providing a brief and simple guide for feeding young children is accomplished in this condensed volume. The intended audience for the excerpt appears to be health care providers, nutrition educators, and community child organizations.

The cost of the volume, the pamphlets, and set of recipe card decreases as the ordered quantity increases, starting at $3.10, $0.85, and $2.65, respectively. The cost may make these items beyond the budgets of some providers without charge. Making them available for sale to clients as a single item or bundled package may be an option.
